instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight no image 55V on backlight
threads.message:
Hey guys

Sorry but I have to ask for help, I’m stuck. 

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 01041 liquid damage
55V on backlight - <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>

I have image and backlight on a screen from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. 

Two known working <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screens give no backlight and no image with 55V on backlight 

Touchbar works, keyboard backlight works, I can regulate lcd and kb backlight using external screen. 

Replaced blown mux chip. 
Replaced connector on the screen side tcon board, reconstructed exploded <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> - L8504, <CAPACITOR>C8504</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8552</CAPACITOR>. 

No visible damage anywhere else, logic board aide connector looks fine. 

From what I under this might have something to do with led load circuits or backlight sense or even backlight controller <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>. 

I’m having trouble understanding how the backlight sense circuit works and how to diagnose it.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight no image 55V on backlight
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight no image 55V on backlight
threads.message:
Keep in mind, when you get higher voltage than normal on backlight output, the electronic circuitry is good.
There can only be open connection to LEDs strip; like bad LCD connector, flex, or screen itself.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight no image 55V on backlight
threads.message: Aight, thanks. It was unexpected for me that those trouble could be caused by wrong cable. But of course the pin outs vary from one model to another, what can be data pin on one can be ground or unconnected on another
